Author: zhyder
Content:
To be fair, I've found cops check for traffic violations more in safe areas (e.g. Silicon Valley), than in unsafe areas (e.g. Berkeley/Oakland) where cops are busy busting real criminals. So they do prioritize to some extent.

In the Silicon Valley area, I've seen more in-town speed traps than on the freeway; I received one citation for 40 in a 25mph zone, and had other close calls. Maybe it's different where you live.

"...should be concentrating on tail gating, should be prosecuting inattentive drivers, ticketing drivers with no lane control etc etc."\nThey probably don't do this as much as these violations are more subjective and harder to prove in court. Also there's some correlation between people who speed and people who tail-gate, etc.

"As for the poor, they do not appear in Locke's little book at all."[45] In his "Essay on the Poor Law," Locke turns to the education of the poor; he laments that "the children of labouring people are an ordinary burden to the parish, and are usually maintained in idleness, so that their labour also is generally lost to the public till they are 12 or 14 years old."[46] He suggests, therefore, that "working schools" be set up in each parish in England for poor children so that they will be "from infancy [three years old] inured to work."[47] He goes on to outline the\neconomics of these schools, arguing not only that they will be profitable for the parish but also that they will instill a good work ethic in the children.[48]"

Contrast this with what he suggests to an Aristocrat in Some Thoughts Concerning Education which should be taught to all children regardless of class.

The point; slaves are taught a "good work ethic"(the same as "working hard") and the ruling class are not.

Author: brennannovak
Content: Self-discipline is a very conscious effort. But when one needs to be creative one needs to be operating out of the sub-conscious and the conscious mind. However, it seems a certain amount of distractions and randomness are needed for any truly great creative thinking. I think the goal is to balance the two. Therefore, if adding discipline to one area of your life might help it could be totally worth it, like how Einstein would wear identical clothing everyday to free his mind from the business of deciding what to wear...
